item.title: EclipseCon 2020 CFP is Open
item.description: If you are interested in speaking, our call for proposals is now open. Please visit the CFP page for information on how to submit your talk.

item.title: Add Your Voice to the 2020 Jakarta EE Developer Survey
item.description: Our third annual Jakarta EE Developer Survey is now open and I encourage everyone to take a few minutes and complete the survey before the April 30 deadline.

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Releases Eclipse Theia 1.0, a True Open Source Alternative to Visual Studio Code
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation, one of the world’s largest open source foundations, today announced the release of Theia 1.0, a true open source alternative to Microsoft’s popular Visual Studio Code (VS Code) software.

item.title: EclipseCon 2020 to Be Held as Virtual Event
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation is announcing today that it will hold its annual EclipseCon conference as a virtual event.

item.title: Eclipse Foundation Supports EU Funded SmartCLIDE Project
item.description: A European consortium of eleven partners from Germany, Greece, Luxembourg, Portugal, Spain, and the United Kingdom has announced the launch of the SmartCLIDE project, a €4.9 million research project funded by the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation program.

item.title: Eclipse Foundation Board Election Results
item.description: Today we are pleased to announce the results of the Eclipse Foundation Sustaining Member and Committer Member elections for representatives to our Board of Directors. The positions of Sustaining Members and Committer representatives are a vitally important part of the Eclipse Foundation's governance.

item.title: Real-World IoT Adoption
item.description: The results of our first IoT Commercial Adoption survey tell a clear story about what organizations are doing with IoT right now and their plans for production deployments.

item.description: The Eclipse Foundation announced the release of its first annual IoT Commercial Adoption survey.

item.description: With the launch this week of the Sparkplug Working Group, we’re bringing together the industry leaders and technologies needed to drive...

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Launches the Sparkplug Working Group to Bring Device Communications Standardization to the Industrial Internet of Things and Industrial Automation
item.description: Founding members Chevron, Canary Labs, Cirrus Link Solutions, HiveMQ, Inductive Automation, and ORing are defining an open standard specification to create interoperable MQTT IIoT solutions

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Announces the CN4J Day 2020 Event for Building Enterprise Java on Kubernetes
item.description: Today the Eclipse Foundation announced the launch of the Cloud Native for Java (CN4J) Day event, a full-day of expert talks, demos, and thought-provoking sessions focused on enterprise applications implemented using open source vendor-neutral Jakarta EE (successor of Java EE) and Eclipse MicroProfile specifications on Kubernetes.

item.title: Moving Forward With Jakarta EE 9
item.description: On behalf of the Jakarta EE Working Group, we are excited to announce the unanimous approval of the plan for Jakarta EE 9, with an anticipated mid-2020 release.

item.title: The realities of running an open-source community
item.description: The benefits of using open-source software is immeasurable, but it’s not the code itself that makes open-source software an invaluable resource.

item.title: Eclipse Foundation’s New Bylaws Are in Effect
item.description: We are pleased to announce the Eclipse Foundation’s new Bylaws went into effect on January 1, 2020.

item.title: Close to the Edge
item.description: Today we are launching our new Edge Native Working Group to help drive the industry platform for edge computing.

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Launches the Edge Native Working Group to Deliver Production-Grade Code for Open Source Edge Computing
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation today announced the launch of the Edge Native Working Group, a vendor-neutral and code-first industry collaboration that will drive the evolution and broad adoption of open source software for edge computing.

item.title: Participate in the 2019 IoT Commercial Adoption Survey!!
item.description: According to McKinsey, the Internet of Things (IoT) will have a total potential economic impact of up to $11.1 trillion a year by 2025.

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Wins Duke's Choice Award for Open Source Contributions to the Java Ecosystem
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation was awarded a Duke's Choice Award yesterday in recognition for outstanding open source contributions to the Java ecosystem and the community-driven achievement of moving Java EE technologies from Oracle to the Jakarta EE Working Group.

item.title: The Eclipse Foundation Releases Eclipse Che 7, the First Kubernetes-Native IDE, to Make Creating Cloud Native Applications Easier, Faster, and More Secure

item.title: First Release of Eclipse Papyrus for Real Time: Modeling Tool for UML-RT
item.description: The Papyrus Industry Consortium, an Eclipse Foundation Working Group, is pleased to announce the release of Eclipse Papyrus for Real Time v1.0 (Papyrus-RT) a fully open source modeling tool intended for teams working on the design and implementation of embedded reactive systems.

item.title: Eclipse Public License Version 2.0 Approved By OSI and Eclipse Foundation Board of Directors
item.description: The Eclipse Foundation is pleased to announce a new version 2 of the Eclipse Public License (EPL v2) has been approved by the Eclipse Foundation Board of Directors and the Open Source Initiative (OSI).

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Exciting New Eclipse Projects
item.description: The latest newsletter is all about new and exciting projects!

item.title: EclipseCon Europe: Schedule and Keynotes
item.description: The keynotes are announced, and the schedule is on line for ECE 2017. Register now!

item.title: Launching Eclipse IoT Newsletter
item.description: We're lauching a quarterly Eclipse IoT Newsletter. Subscribe to receive the first issue this September.

item.title: Eclipse IoT Day @ ThingMonk
item.description: Register for the Eclipse IoT Day co-located with ThingMonk on September 11 in London, UK.

item.title: Potential adware plugin on Eclipse Marketplace - Eclipse Class Decompiler
item.description: A listing on Eclipse Marketplace, called Eclipse Class Decompiler, contains binary code that could be used for adware and could potentially download files to Eclipse workspaces.

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Summer Issue
item.description: The latest Eclipse Newsletter is now available. Read it and learn how to try out Java 9 Support for Eclipse Oxygen!

item.title: EclipseCon Europe 2017 | Submissions Close in One Week
item.description: There’s still time until July 17th, to get your submission in for this year’s EclipseCon Europe in Ludwigsburg Germany.

item.title: Eclipse Oxygen Now Available
item.description: We're proud to announce the arrival of Eclipse Oxygen, the 12th annual simultaneous release from the Eclipse Community. DOWNLOAD NOW!

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter | Eclipse Oxygen
item.description: Find out more about the latest Eclipse Simultaneous Release in the June issue of the Eclipse Newsletter!

item.title: Early Submission Deadline for EclipseCon Europe 2017
item.description: Submit your talks by June 30 to be selected for featuring in the early promotion. October 24-26 in Ludwigsburg Germany.

item.title: Capella Industry Consortium (IC) Announced at PolarSys
item.description: Capella IC to host the Capella Ecosystem stakeholders in a vendor neutral way, organized by an open governance model.

item.title: RC3 Available for Eclipse Oxygen | Download Now
item.description: Download and test release candidate 3 for Eclipse Oxygen!

item.title: Last Chance to Register for EclipseCon France 2017
item.description: Sign up for learning at EclipseCon France, June 21-22. XText, Capella, Science, Docker, LSP and much more!

item.title: Eclipse Newsletter - Language Server Protocol 101
item.description: Everything you need to know about the Language Server Procotol (aka LSP) is in this month's newsletter!

item.title: It’s time to organise Eclipse Oxygen DemoCamps
item.description: What is an Eclipse DemoCamp and why should I organise one?

item.title: Case Study: Deploying Eclipse IoT on Germany's DB Railway System
item.description: We worked with Deutsche Bahn (DB) to find out how they use Eclipse IoT technology on their railway system!

item.title: EclipseCon Europe 2017 | Call for Papers Open
item.description: Submissions are now open for EclipseCon Europe 2017, October 24 - 26, in Ludwigsburg, Germany.

item.title: Program Ready for EclipseCon France 2017
item.description: See the program, and register by May 12 for the best price.

item.title: New Eclipse IoT Open Testbeds
item.description: Announcing the creation of the Eclipse IoT Open Testbeds, an initiative to drive adoption of IoT open source and open standards.
